category: Accounting regulations/Article 40 (Budget execution when budget is not established)
contents: Article 40 (Budget execution when budget is not established) ① When the budget is not established before the start of the fiscal year due to unavoidable reasons, it may be executed within the performance range of the previous year only for the following matters included in the budget for the fiscal year. Revised on February 28, 2013, 1. Compensation of executives and employees and basic expenses necessary for business activities, 2. Facility maintenance costs, 3. Pension project and continuing business expenses, ② The budget executed pursuant to paragraph 1 constitutes the budget for the relevant year. If so, it is deemed to have been executed in accordance with the established budget.
